meanings.sent1: She would often platitudinize during her speeches, repeating the same cliches over and over.
meanings.sent2: The politician tends to platitudinize when addressing the public, lacking originality in her statements.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to platitudinize at the party fell flat, as everyone had heard those tired phrases before.
meanings.sent4: As the meeting dragged on, his words began to platitudinize, losing any impact they may have had.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's lesson on recycling was so platitudinized that the students quickly lost interest.

meanings.definition: To speak or write in a dull, flat, or trite manner.
meanings.sent1: The author's writing style tends to platitudinize, lacking any excitement or originality.
meanings.sent2: During the presentation, he began to platitudinize, causing many in the audience to lose interest.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to platitudinize his way through the debate only made his opponent's arguments seem more compelling.
meanings.sent4: The speech started strong but quickly began to platitudinize, losing the attention of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: Her writing had the tendency to platitudinize, making it difficult for readers to stay engaged.
